title: [Bug] RandomCrop  on (torchvision\transforms\transforms.py .. line 411)
body_html:
🐛 Bug

To Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:

  1. I'm following https://pytorch.org/tutorials/beginner/blitz/cifar10_tutorial.html

  2. And I changed
    trainloader.dataset.transform = transforms.Compose([
    transforms.RandomCrop(size=32, padding=(0,1,2,3)),
    transforms.RandomHorizontalFlip(),transforms.ToTensor(),
    transforms.Normalize((0.5, 0.5, 0.5), (0.5, 0.5, 0.5))])

  3. Error apeared in \torchvision\transforms\transforms.py .. line 411
    self.padding > 0 do not work, because I inserted tuple..

  4. I just erased that line and code is working well.

  5. Isn't it bug? I think that line should be erased or add some lines for sequances.

Environment

  • PyTorch Version : 0.4.1
  • torchvision Version : 0.2.1
  • OS (e.g., Linux): window, anaconda, spyder, prompt
  • Python version: 3.6

body:
## 🐛 Bug

<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->

## To Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:

1. I'm following https://pytorch.org/tutorials/beginner/blitz/cifar10_tutorial.html 
2. And   I changed 
      trainloader.dataset.transform = transforms.Compose([
                                         transforms.RandomCrop(size=32, padding=(0,1,2,3)),            
                                         transforms.RandomHorizontalFlip(),transforms.ToTensor(),
                                         transforms.Normalize((0.5, 0.5, 0.5), (0.5, 0.5, 0.5))])
3. Error apeared in \torchvision\transforms\transforms.py .. line 411
self.padding > 0 do not work, because I inserted tuple..

4. I just erased that line and code is working well.

5. Isn't it bug? I think that line should be erased or add some lines for sequances.

<!-- If you have a code sample, error messages, stack traces, please provide it here as well -->

## Environment

 - PyTorch Version : 0.4.1
 - torchvision Version : 0.2.1
 - OS (e.g., Linux): window, anaconda, spyder, prompt
 - Python version: 3.6
